intro: Leria integrifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf leria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, broad leaves with entire margins and showy, pale pink to white flowers. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Leria integrifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
